datafield.subfield: General Council of the Bar (England and Wales)
Senate of the Inns of Court and the Bar

Qualifier reflects that the body does not apply to Scotland (Faculty of Advocates) and Northern Ireland (Bar Council of Northern Ireland) and does not refer to the country England and Wales (1536-1707)
Amendments to the third ed. of the Code of conduct for the Bar of England and Wales, 1987:

prelim. p. 1 (Senate of the Inns of Court and the Bar ... ceased to exist as such at the end of 1986. From Jan. 1, 1987 it sep. into two entities: General Council of the Bar and Council of the Inns of Court)
p. 1 (Bar Council) p. 2 (General Council of the Bar)
General Council of the Bar WWW Home page, May 9, 2001
(General Council of the Bar of England and Wales)
The crisis of human rights in Bahrain, 1998:
cover (The Bar of England and Wales)

(The Bar Council; The General Council of the Bar; the General Council of the Bar (known as the Bar Council) was founded in 1894; represents a wide variety of interests at the Bar and is made up of 115 barristers who are elected or represent the Inns, Circuits, and Specialist Bar Associations)
